sn8.11:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Campa on the banks of the Gaggara Lotus Pond, together with a large Sangha of five hundred mendicants, seven hundred male and seven hundred female lay followers, and many thousands of deities.
sn8.11:1.2: But the Buddha outshone them all in beauty and glory.
sn8.11:1.4: “The Buddha is staying near Campa on the banks of the Gaggara Lotus Pond, together with a large Sangha of five hundred mendicants, seven hundred male and seven hundred female lay followers, and many thousands of deities.
sn8.11:1.5: And he outshines them all in beauty and glory.
sn8.11:1.6: Why don’t I extoll him in his presence with fitting verses?”
sn8.11:2.1: Then Venerable Vangisa got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha, and said,
sn8.11:2.2: “I feel inspired to speak, Blessed One! I feel inspired to speak, Holy One!”
sn8.11:2.3: “Then speak as you feel inspired,” said the Buddha.
sn8.11:2.4: Then Vangisa extolled the Buddha in his presence with fitting verses:
sn8.11:3.1: “Like the moon on a cloudless night,
sn8.11:3.3: so too Angirasa, O great sage,
sn8.11:3.4: your glory outshines the entire world.”
